elements.title: life (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that life exists in every part of the biosphere, from the deepest parts of the ocean (bacterium pictured) to altitudes of up to 40 miles (64 km) in the atmosphere?

elements.title: Spyridon Marinatos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Spyridon Marinatos discovered the battlefield of Thermopylae in 1939?

elements.title: Lenin–Stalinnьꞑ tugunuꞑ adaa-pile (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1944, the Tuvan-language journal Lenin–Stalinnьꞑ tugunuꞑ adaa-pile switched from the Latin script to the Cyrillic script?

elements.title: a system for the safe braking of heavy trains on steep gradients (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that railroad engineer Jules Hanscotte developed a system for the safe braking of heavy trains on steep gradients, but its only significant use was on tourist tramways?

elements.title: William Sharpington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Sharpington and his workshop created what was described as "some of the most distinguished" public lettering in post-war England?

elements.title: a separate party was created for Pakistan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before a separate party was created for Pakistan, the All India Scheduled Castes Federation simultaneously held the posts of Minister of Law in both Pakistan and India?

elements.title: Washington Wolfpack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the owner of the Washington Wolfpack said that he initially only wanted to try out some players from his semi-professional team, but they gave him ownership instead?

elements.title: Hö'elün (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one legend claimed that Hö'elün conceived the boy who would become Genghis Khan when she was impregnated by a ray of light?
